intro: Allophylus laxiflorus, commonly known as the broad-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pentamerous flowers with five petals. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Allophylus laxiflorus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
